channel.title: Daily Express :: World Feed
channel.description: Simply The Best 7 Days A Week

item.title: The incredible new Â£112bn bridge spanning 3 miles and connecting 2 countries
item.description: The bridge will have two lanes and connect to the newly constructed border crossing.
item.author: John Varga
item.media:keywords: Russia, North Korea, Moscow Pyongyang Train, Vladimir Putin, Kim Jong un, Tumen River, Korea-Russia Friendship Bridge, Infrastructure, Russia North Korea car bridge Car , Russia North Korea car bridge Car

media:content.media:description: North Korea and Russia are connected by a Soviet-era rail bridge

media:thumbnail.media:description: North Korea and Russia are connected by a Soviet-era rail bridge

item.title: Iran hit with 5.1-magnitude earthquake near nuclear site amid rumours of regime 'testing'
item.description: The earthquake struck at a depth of 10km , and was reported at approximately 9:19 p.m. local time amid rumours of Republican Guard 'testing' nearby
item.author: Jeremiah Hassel,Michael D. Carroll
item.media:keywords: Iran, Iran-Israel conflict, Iran earthquake, Fordow nuclear facility, Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, Israeli missile strike

item.title: Brits could face extra holiday fee thanks to EU debt
item.description: The move could hinder the recent easing of post-Brexit tensions between London and Brussels.
item.author: Rebecca Robinson
item.media:keywords: Brexit News, European Union, British tourists, EU entry fee, Brexit impact, ETIAS system

media:content.media:description: The EU is trying to find ways to pay off its debts.

media:thumbnail.media:description: The EU is trying to find ways to pay off its debts.

item.title: Crisis in Greece as coastguard rescues over 400 migrants on small boats in 24 hours
item.description: The number represents the largest one day influx for the small island of Gavdos which has been pushed to the limit.
item.author: Conor Wilson
item.media:keywords: Greece, Migrant Crisis, Immigration, Gavdos, Greek coastguard, Greek island, migration crisis, migration, migrant influx

media:content.media:description: The island has seen an uptick in arrivals in 2025

media:thumbnail.media:description: The island has seen an uptick in arrivals in 2025

item.title: Benidorm holiday horror as British mum details encounter with teen thugs
item.description: A British mum-of-two has urged tourists to take care in Spain after her hotel room was raided by teenage thugs.
item.author: Emily Wright
item.media:keywords: British tourists, Travel advice, Benidorm, Spain, Hotels, British tourist warning, hotel room robbery, travel safety advice, Becca Farley, warned tourists, keep your wits about you, tourist hotspot, power cut, Magic Tropical Splash, petrified

media:content.media:description: A Brit has urged tourists to take care in Spain after her hotel room was raided by thugs.

media:thumbnail.media:description: A Brit has urged tourists to take care in Spain after her hotel room was raided by thugs.

item.title: 'Furious' Kim Jong Un forces North Korean show of loyalty after huge public 'humiliation'
item.description: The North Korean regime's reaction following a disastrous ship launch demonstrates a change in approach to failure, according to experts.
item.author: Conor Wilson
item.media:keywords: North Korea, Kim Jong-un, ship launch, military, regime, loyalty, Pyongyang, communism, socialism, Korea, Korean penninsula

media:content.media:description: Kim Jong Un ordered those responsible for the failure to be punished

media:thumbnail.media:description: Kim Jong Un ordered those responsible for the failure to be punished

item.title: Russia economy meltdown as Moscow 'on the brink of recession'
item.description: There is mounting pressure on the economy to garner investments in sectors other than the military to avoid stagnation.
item.author: Rebecca Robinson
item.media:keywords: Oil, Economy, Recession, Russia economy, recession warning, oil and gas revenue, sanctions impact

media:content.media:description: Economy Minister Maxim Reshetnikov warned of an incoming recession.

media:thumbnail.media:description: Economy Minister Maxim Reshetnikov warned of an incoming recession.

item.title: UK pulls all staff out of Iran as fears of US attack on Tehran grow
item.description: US President Donald Trump will make a decision on whether to strike Iran within two weeks.
item.author: Charlie Bradley,Toby Codd
item.media:keywords: Iran, Israel, Donald Trump, iran news, uk embassy iran, israel news

item.title: Chaos in France as incest law change blocked by Macron's government
item.description: Incest has remained a thorny social and political issue for France, where the word only appeared in the criminal law code in 2010.
item.author: John Varga
item.media:keywords: France, Emmanuel Macron, Incest, Religion, Europe, France Criminal Code, Paris, Law

media:content.media:description: Emmanuel Macron is under pressure to change incest laws

media:thumbnail.media:description: Emmanuel Macron is under pressure to change incest laws

item.title: Putin puppet shamelessly reveals why Russia won't stop bombing Ukraine
item.description: Putin has repeatedly rejected calls from the Trump administration and Volodymyr Zelensky for a 30-day ceasefire, and has stalled attempts to negotiate a peace deal.
item.author: John Varga
item.media:keywords: Russia, Ukraine, Vladimir Putin, Dmitry Peskov, Kremlin, Volodymyr Zelensky, Russia Ukraine peace talks, St. Petersburg International Economic Forum , St. Petersburg International Economic Forum

media:content.media:description: Putin is increasingly confident of military victory in Ukraine

media:thumbnail.media:description: Putin is increasingly confident of military victory in Ukraine
